lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrg huie BRmn ko BRmu KoieE crn srin gur eyk tyk DwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Maarag Hui Bhraman Ko Bhramu Khoiao , Charan Sarani Gur Ayk Tayk Dhaaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By becoming a traveller on the path set by the True Guru, disciple of the Guru sheds the illusion of wandering at places and takes the refuge of the holy feet of the True Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: drs drs smdrs iDAwn Dwir sbd suriq kY sMswrI inrMkwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Daras Daras Samadaras Dhiaan Dhaari , Sabad Surati Kai Sansaaree Nirankaaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Concentrating his mind on the True Guru, he starts looking at others as equal. By the union of the True Guru's blessed teaching in his consciousness, he becomes divine from being worldly.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur syvw kir suir nr syvk hY mwin gur AwigAw siB jgu AwigAwkwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sayvaa Kari Suri Nar Sayvak Hai , Maani Gur Aagiaa Sabhi Jagu Aagiaakaaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By serving the True Guru diligently, gods and other humans become his servants. Having obeyed the command of the True Guru, the whole world then starts obeying him.

lines.gurmukhi: pUjw pRwn pRwnpiq srb inDwn dwn pwrs prs giq praupkwrI hY ]261]
lines.transliteration_english: Poojaa Praan Praanapati Sarab Nidhaan Daana , Paaras Paras Gati Paraoupakaaree Hai ?261?

Shabad OS B.translation: By worshipping the life granting and bestower of all treasures of the world, he becomes like a philosopher-stone. Whosoever comes in his contact, he does good turn to him. (261)
